chapter.name: MaxScore: Sidebar
chapter.p: On top of the right sidebar you can see four tab item:
Each of these tabs corresponds to specific tools which feature their own GUI:

Under Tools you can customize the note durations or pauses, hide or modify note heads and other attributes, create beamings and note groups, add markings, as well as select key signatures, set the tempo, measure width, and pick various barlines. O n this pane, you can also set pitch (see also Pitch Utility fot more choices), amplitude, duration, and text attributes. For advanced users, the "Inspect" button provides an option to inspect various elements or the entire score in JSON format.

In the Pitch Utility you can perform a wide range of pitch-selection operations, apply transpositions in cent precision and take advantage of the possibility of entering microtonal scales with the Virtual Keyboards included in the Entry Tool menu on the bottom.
Scorepions provide a plugin structure for MaxScore which allow you to use existing Max patches to process scores and to ultimately add your own plugins to the repertoire.

The Scorepions currently included in the MaxScore package are:
Accent Threshold Transform
Amplitude Crescendo Transform
Amplitude to Dynamics Transform
Artificial Harmonic Transform
Augmentation-Diminuation Transform
Chord to Melody Transform
Create Click Track
Diatonic Transposition Transform
DJster Autobus-Scorepion
Double Below Transform
Dynamics To Amplitude Transform
Enharmonic Spelling Transform
Fill Empty Measures with Rests
Fix Issues
Inversion Transform
Markov Operator
Melody to Chord Transform
Move Track Transform
Retrograde Transform
Scramble Transform
Scrolling Score Creator
Serial Transform
Text To Picster Transform
Zipper Transform
Selecting a Scorepions from the menu on top will load the Scorepion from disk which displays the instructions as to how to use it and its GUI elements.

The Picster pane provides a GUI to the sophisticated graphics editor, designed to add various graphical elements or to create an entire graphical score with the ability to attach Expressions to every graphical element. Expressions contain messages which can be used to control the Max environment.

p.i: You will find more information on these four tools in the following chapters.
